page.title: 13CROSSFORD GALA 1985
page.content: Each year, usually nearing the first week of June, the village of Crossford has its own Children's Gala. In 1985 this week began on Saturday 25th May with a kick-start competition, local children negotiating their cycles over a variety of obstacles. The first major event however, fast becoming traditional, was the family day barbeque on the 26th, in the grounds of the Keavil House Hotel. These grounds were also used for discos on the 30th. A car treasure hunt for all the family, followed by a country and western night at the Pitfirrane Arms Hotel, were the Wednesday night events, but the 5-a-side football competitions remained the principal attraction for many. Preliminary rounds, for junior and senior boys and for junior girls, were held during the week, finals on Gala day itself.(p.14)
